content:
• Tuesday, January 15, 2013
  • ATRC

    Atricure (NASDAQ:ATRC) says it plans to offer stock in a public offering as part of its $50M...

    Atricure (NASDAQ:ATRC) says it plans to offer stock in a public offering as part of its $50M shelf registration filed in July, 2011. Piper Jaffray is acting as the sole manager for the offering. Shares -2.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:38 PM
  • PCRX

    Pacira Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PCRX) offers $100M in aggregate principal of convertible senior...

    Pacira Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PCRX) offers $100M in aggregate principal of convertible senior notes due 2019, with the interest rate, conversion rate, offering price and other terms to be determined at the time of pricing. Shares -4.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • HLF

    Shares of Herbalife (NYSE:HLF) are getting a bump in after hours trade on the back of comments...

    Shares of Herbalife (NYSE:HLF) are getting a bump in after hours trade on the back of comments made by trader Karen Fineman on CNBC's show Fast Money. Fineman suggested that it's possible that long holders like Dan Loeb could ignite a short squeeze by pulling their stock from margin. Shares +1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:44 PM | 3 Comments
  • STAG

    Stag Industrial (NYSE:STAG) announces a 5M shares secondary offering, with a 30-day...

    Stag Industrial (NYSE:STAG) announces a 5M shares secondary offering, with a 30-day overallotment option for an additional 750K shares. RBC Capital Markets, BofA Merrill Lynch and Wells Fargo Securities are all acting as joint book runners. Shares -2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM
  • VRA

    Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA) +8.5% AH after announcing it expects to report FQ4 (ends in Jan.)...

    Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA) +8.5% AH after announcing it expects to report FQ4 (ends in Jan.) revenue of $149-$154M and EPS of $0.56-$0.58, numbers that compare favorably with prior guidance ranges of $147M-$152M and $0.55-$0.57 - the consensus stands at $151.5M and $0.56. Though same-store sales are expected to be flat Y/Y (worse than guidance for low-single digit growth), indirect net sales are seen beating expectations. Shares had priced in some bad news.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:54 PM
  • ONXX

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) announces a 4.4M share secondary offering with a 30-day...

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) announces a 4.4M share secondary offering with a 30-day option to purchase up to an additional 660K shares to cover over-allotments, if any. The offering is expected to close by January 22, 2013, and the company intends to use the net proceeds to fund its clinical development programs, R&D, and sales and marketing activities to globally commercialize Kyprolis. BofA Merrill Lynch and Barclays are co-book runners. Shares -2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM
  • CBK

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: CBK +8%. TTMI +7%. VRA +5%. ARQL +5%. GMAN +4%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: CBK +8%. TTMI +7%. VRA +5%. ARQL +5%. GMAN +4%.
    After-hours top losers: FIVE -4%. CIE -4%. PCRX -3%. HOV -3%. FULT -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • CIE

    Cobalt Energy (NYSE:CIE) -4.8% AH after announcing a secondary public offering of 40M common...

    Cobalt Energy (NYSE:CIE) -4.8% AH after announcing a secondary public offering of 40M common shares, all of which will be offered by selling stockholders. CIE will receive no proceeds from the sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • CBK

    Christopher & Banks (NYSE:CBK) lifts its same-store sales guidance for Q4, as the women's...

    Christopher & Banks (NYSE:CBK) lifts its same-store sales guidance for Q4, as the women's clothing retailer starts to see some signs of life from its turnaround plan. It now expects same-store sales to increase in the high teens, compared with its single to low double digit previous view. Shares +9.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • IBKR

    Interactive Brokers Group, Inc. (IEX:IBKR) declares $0.10/share quarterly dividend, in line with...

    Interactive Brokers Group, Inc. (IEX:IBKR) declares $0.10/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield 2.84%. For shareholders of record Mar. 01. Payable Mar. 14. Ex-div date Feb. 27. Shares -3.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • IBKR

    Interactive Brokers (IEX:IBKR): Q4 EPS of $0.19 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $259.6M (-21% Y/Y)...

    Interactive Brokers (IEX:IBKR): Q4 EPS of $0.19 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $259.6M (-21% Y/Y) misses by $21.65M. Shares -4.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • PDLI

    PDL BioPharma (PDLI -5.3%) slips after Credit Suisse cut the shares to Neutral on valuation and...

    PDL BioPharma (PDLI -5.3%) slips after Credit Suisse cut the shares to Neutral on valuation and lowers its price target from $6.50 to $6.00. The firm adds that PDLI lacks significant optionality as new products deliver a finite and relatively short revenue stream.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • VECO

    Veeco (VECO -3.4%) has a bad day after Piper starts coverage with a Neutral and $27 PT. Shares...

    Veeco (VECO -3.4%) has a bad day after Piper starts coverage with a Neutral and $27 PT. Shares of the hard-luck LED/solar equipment maker have been range-bound for a while. LED equipment rival Aixtron (AIXG -3.4%) is also lower.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • PAAS

    Deutsche Bank downgrades Pan American Silver (PAAS -2.3%) to Hold from Buy, saying that while...

    Deutsche Bank downgrades Pan American Silver (PAAS -2.3%) to Hold from Buy, saying that while the firm still sees upside to gold and silver prices, many precious metal firms are not generating sufficient EPS to justify upside based on P/E multiples of Industrial peers. Hecla Mining (HL -2.5%) and Silver Standard (SSRI -1.9%) are cut to Sell, citing a lack of earnings growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • BSX

    Boston Scientific (BSX +2.5%) hits a 16-month high today after Credit Suisse upped the stock to...

    Boston Scientific (BSX +2.5%) hits a 16-month high today after Credit Suisse upped the stock to Outperform, citing a better top-line and improved visibility. On those catalysts, the firm reduces the valuation discount it thinks the stock should trade at versus rivals St. Jude (NYSE:STJ) and Medtronic (NYSE:MDT) to 10%. The stock currently trades at around a 20% discount to its peers.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • DELL-OLD

    Dell (DELL-OLD +5.4%) adds to its gains as Reuters reports LBO talks are now " in an advanced...

    Dell (DELL-OLD +5.4%) adds to its gains as Reuters reports LBO talks are now " in an advanced stage," with 4 banks lined up to offer financing. P-E firm Silver Lake is said to be leading the deal, and working with one of its major investors in the process. Topeka's Brian White thinks a $15-$18/share price tag is possible, and Jefferies' Peter Misek views a $15-$17 price as achievable. But like others, Misek notes Dell presents unique challenges to P-E firms. (Bloomberg report) (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 5 Comments
  • YELP

    Yelp (YELP -6.9%) has sold off as Facebook (FB -2%) shows off Graph Search; investors seem to to...

    Yelp (YELP -6.9%) has sold off as Facebook (FB -2%) shows off Graph Search; investors seem to to be fretting Yelp traffic will be hurt as Facebook's tool is used to search for businesses a user's "friends" have visited/liked. However, Graph Search is far from a direct rival. Google (GOOG -0.2%) has slipped a little after Mark Zuckerberg notes Bing (NASDAQ:MSFT) will be a fallback option for searches. Zuck: "Graph Search is a really big project that will take years and years to index the whole map and the graph" (live blog)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 7 Comments
  • ECYT

    Endocyte (ECYT +3.2%) gets an upside bump from an intitation at Credit Suisse with an Outperform...

    Endocyte (ECYT +3.2%) gets an upside bump from an intitation at Credit Suisse with an Outperform rating and and a price target of $16. The firm thinks the stock should see significant appreciation ahead of some key catalysts in early 2014, including a potential EU approval, pivotal Phase III data in ovarian cancer, and robust Phase II data in lung cancer. Those drivers, plus a deep-pocket partner in Merck, make for a favorable risk/reward profile.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • NKTR

    Nektar Therapeutics (NKTR +5.4%) gets a big boost out of Lazard Capital today, after it...

    Nektar Therapeutics (NKTR +5.4%) gets a big boost out of Lazard Capital today, after it initiated the drug developer with a Buy rating and a price target of $15 a share. The company has a solid pipeline with a number of drugs on its docket, including Naloxegol, which has just finished Phase III testing, Cipro DPI with Bayer in Phase III and Baxter 855 and Amikacin Inhale preparing for Phase III. Royalties on these products alone are capable of generating over $750M a year.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • RKUS

    Ruckus Wireless (RKUS +4.8%) is having a good day following positive remarks from Jim Cramer....

    Ruckus Wireless (RKUS +4.8%) is having a good day following positive remarks from Jim Cramer. Last night, the Mad Money host declared Ruckus to be transforming Wi-Fi, and said he a fan in the event of weakness. Shares are now up 52% from a November IPO price of $15.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • DNR

    Although most energy stocks are lower, Denbury Resources (DNR +4.3%) is up sharply after...

    Although most energy stocks are lower, Denbury Resources (DNR +4.3%) is up sharply after unveiling a $1B deal with ConocoPhillips (COP +0.5%) for 86K acres in Montana and North Dakota. The deal gives DNR additional liquidity to help it execute its share repurchase program, and allows for a deferment of more than $400M in taxes. For COP, the deal allows it to better focus on its Bakken assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • IRWD

    Ironwood Pharmaceuticals (IRWD +1%) gives a Q4 business update on the commercial launch of its...

    Ironwood Pharmaceuticals (IRWD +1%) gives a Q4 business update on the commercial launch of its irritable bowel syndrome Linzess in the U.S., saying its partner, Forest Laboratories (NYSE:FRX) reported Q4 product sales of $19.2M. The company also said another commercial partner, Almirall, received approval for Constella for the treatment of moderate to severe irritable bowel syndrome in the European Union. Commercial launch will be initiated in the first half of FY13.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • EXPR

    Midday top 10 gainers: EXPR +22%. EGAN +20%. ENOC +19%. FSGI +15%. GBR +15%. NVTL +13%. RSYS...

    Midday top 10 gainers: EXPR +22%. EGAN +20%. ENOC +19%. FSGI +15%. GBR +15%. NVTL +13%. RSYS +12%. BGFV +11%. DOM +10%. ETAK +10%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: COOL -32%. MFLX -22%. MEAD -20%. CWTR -20%. GMAN -16%. OTCQB:BODY -15%. OTCQB:TELK -15%. KGJI -13%. RBPAA -12%. GIVN -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • CRUS

    Another day, another Apple supplier selloff due to iPhone sales worries. CRUS -2.8%. NTE -3.2%....

    Another day, another Apple supplier selloff due to iPhone sales worries. CRUS -2.8%. NTE -3.2%. BRCM -1.6%. SWKS -2.5%. AVGO -1.5%. LPL -3.5% MU -1.9%. Cirrus Logic now trades at just 7.3x FY14 (ends March '14) EPS, putting it squarely in value territory provided estimates don't get cut too much - Sterne Agee thinks iPhone order cuts are already baked into March quarter Cirrus estimates. Skyworks is at 8.4x FY14E (ends Sep. '14) EPS. (yesterday) (Multi-Fineline warning)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 4 Comments
  • NOVT

    GSI Group (GSIG +8.3%) gains after saying it's acquired NDS Surgical Imaging, a producer of high...

    GSI Group (GSIG +8.3%) gains after saying it's acquired NDS Surgical Imaging, a producer of high performance visualization products sold to the surgical endoscopy and radiology markets, for $82.5M in cash. The company expects the transaction to be earnings accretive and to add more than $80M in revenue and nearly $12M of Adjusted EBITDA to GSIG's bottom line in FY13.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM -3.4%) is cooling off following a giant 2-day rally, even as Charter's...

    Research In Motion (RIMM -3.4%) is cooling off following a giant 2-day rally, even as Charter's Ed Snyder upgrades shares to Buy. Snyder liked what he saw in a "preliminary review" of BB10, and praises the OS' interface, 70K apps, and keyboard. He argues BB10 enthusiasm could help investors look past services pricing worries. But a lot of investors have already done that.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM | 8 Comments
  • SAP

    With shares nearly priced to perfection following a big 6-month rally, SAP (SAP -4.3%) is...

    With shares nearly priced to perfection following a big 6-month rally, SAP (SAP -4.3%) is selling off after pre-announcing light operating income and revenue (€5.06B vs. €5.12B consensus) for Q4. The report does note Hana revenue surged to nearly €200M from Q3's €83M, but software license growth of 9% Y/Y is a slowdown from Q3's 17%. Cloud subscription/support revenue nearly doubled Q/Q to €159M, but is still just 3% of total sales. EMEA software sales +8%, Americas +3%, Asia-Pac +23%. Oracle recently claimed it took share from SAP in Europe.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • MBI

    MBIA (NYSE:MBI) looks to have come close to default, with NY State denying its request to make a...

    MBIA (NYSE:MBI) looks to have come close to default, with NY State denying its request to make a scheduled interest payment due today. "No interest will accure on the deferred interest," according to the 8-K. Initially diving on the news, shares have returned to about unchanged.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • VECO

    Veeco Instruments (VECO -2.4%) succumbs to technical resistance today, in spite of its earlier...

    Veeco Instruments (VECO -2.4%) succumbs to technical resistance today, in spite of its earlier announcement that the Korean Photonics Technology Institute has purchased one of its GEN20 Molecular Beam Epitaxy systems. The system will be shipped to the institute's Laser-IT Research Center and Photonics System Lab in Gwangju, South Korea for high-powered laser diode research.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • ENOC

    EnerNOC (ENOC +20.4%) shares spike as the EPA announces finalized revisions to clean air...

    EnerNOC (ENOC +20.4%) shares spike as the EPA announces finalized revisions to clean air standards for stationary engines. The final revised rule reduces the capital and annual costs of the original 2010 rules by $287M and $139M, respectively, while reducing harmful pollutants.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceutical (VRTX -2.5%) dips this morning on a Lazard downgrade to Neutral, saying it...

    Vertex Pharmaceutical (VRTX -2.5%) dips this morning on a Lazard downgrade to Neutral, saying it prefers to wait for more clarity from its pipeline. The firm believes much of its value is aready priced in, and until a better saftety profile is established for its cystic fibrosis drug Kalydeco and its investigational drug VX-809, there are few catalysts left the to move the stock higher over the near-term.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • GOLD

    Barrick Gold (ABX +2%) says it has achieved commercial production at its 60%-owned Pueblo Viejo...

    Barrick Gold (ABX +2%) says it has achieved commercial production at its 60%-owned Pueblo Viejo mine in the Dominican Republic; Goldcorp (GG +2.1%) owns 40%. Ramp-up to full capacity is expected to occur in H2 2013, and production for the year is anticipated at 500K-650K oz.; ABX's share of annual production in the first full five years is expected to average 625K-675K oz.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 3 Comments
  • SHPG

    ViroPharma (VPHM +6.2%) moves up after BofA Merrill Lynch ups its rating to Buy on valuation,...

    ViroPharma (VPHM +6.2%) moves up after BofA Merrill Lynch ups its rating to Buy on valuation, citing higher sales projections for Cinryze. The firm now sees 2013 sales of $411M, up from $400M, reflecting a better Q4 and increased first-quarter inventory fill.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • FCEL

    FuelCell Energy (FCEL -3.4%) shares slide after the developer of fuel cell power plants reports...

    FuelCell Energy (FCEL -3.4%) shares slide after the developer of fuel cell power plants reports a Y/Y drop in revenue for FY 2012. Total revenues for the year ended Oct. 31 was ~$120M, 2% lower than the prior year, including an 8% drop in product sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 4 Comments
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL -2.3%) has tumbled below $500 following Nomura's big PT cut. Multi-Fineline's (MFLX...

    Apple (AAPL -2.3%) has tumbled below $500 following Nomura's big PT cut. Multi-Fineline's (MFLX -20.3%) warning also might not be going over well. Nomura backs up the WSJ and Nikkei's reports by stating its own checks indicate weaker-than-expected iPhone 5 sales; it now expects 48M sales in FQ1, and 39M in FQ2, but is raising its iPad forecasts. Echoing a recent CLSA note, Nomura thinks Android's Asian dominance has become a problem for Apple. Sterne Agee, meanwhile, believes all is well.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 48 Comments
  • ITMN

    InterMune (ITMN -4.7%) slips after the company announces an offering of 12.5M shares as well as...

    InterMune (ITMN -4.7%) slips after the company announces an offering of 12.5M shares as well as $85M aggregate principal amount of notes due in 2017. ITMN's float currently stands at around 66M shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • AGI

    Alamos Gold (NYSE:AGI) is a low-cost, open-pit gold miner in Mexico, while Aurizon Mines (AZK...

    Alamos Gold (NYSE:AGI) is a low-cost, open-pit gold miner in Mexico, while Aurizon Mines (AZK +2.1%) is a higher-cost, underground gold miner in Quebec. With no obvious strategic fit, analysts were caught off-guard by AGI's hostile bid for AZK; a Raymond James analyst is concerned about operating issues at AZK’s Casa Berardi mine, while another at the same firm sees the mine as fairly valued.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • ANGI

    Angie's List (ANGI +4.5%) rallies on an upgrade to Buy from B. Riley, which touts the local...

    Angie's List (ANGI +4.5%) rallies on an upgrade to Buy from B. Riley, which touts the local services site's growth, margins, brand positioning, and exposure to the local ad market. In spite of a positive Q3 report and favorable sell-side commentary (I, II), shares remain well below their post-IPO highs.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 3 Comments
  • PDH

    PetroLogistics (PDH +2.7%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral at Citigroup, as the spread between...

    PetroLogistics (PDH +2.7%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral at Citigroup, as the spread between propane and topropylene has expanded to above $0.40/lb. from an average $0.31/lb. in Q4 due to the warmer-than-average winter. The firm lifts its NTM distribution/unit to $1.70 (+$0.20) driven by higher spreads and including an estimated $0.06 hit from the recent outage.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • MLNX

    Beaten-down Mellanox (MLNX +4.8%) is provided some relief by UBS, which is upgrading shares to...

    Beaten-down Mellanox (MLNX +4.8%) is provided some relief by UBS, which is upgrading shares to Buy. The firm argues downside is now limited, and expects Mellanox to remain competitive in the InfiniBand hardware market in spite of new competition from Intel. (Q4 warning)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • CIM

    Chimera Investment (CIM +3.9%) is off to the races following its receipt of a one-month...

    Chimera Investment (CIM +3.9%) is off to the races following its receipt of a one-month extension from the NYSE to file its 2011 annual report. Such a short period of time could be taken to mean the company is all but ready to comply. Six weeks ago, an SA Pro author speculated the numbers could unleash plenty of upside to the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • LMNX

    Luminex (LMNX +2.7%) trades back down to earth following a +10% jump at the open after receiving...

    Luminex (LMNX +2.7%) trades back down to earth following a +10% jump at the open after receiving FDA clearance for its xTAG Gastrointestinal Pathogen Panel, the first comprehensive molecular diagnostic assay that tests for greater than 90% of infectious causes of gastroenteritis in a single test.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • LOGI

    A day after rallying thanks to a Goldman upgrade, Logitech (LOGI -4.2%) is selling off following...

    A day after rallying thanks to a Goldman upgrade, Logitech (LOGI -4.2%) is selling off following a downgrade to Underperform from Credit Suisse. Weak PC and home electronics peripherals sales continue to make life tough for Logitech, which just saw a CEO change.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • FTI

    Morgan Stanley upgrades FMC Technologies (FTI +1.5%), Oceaneering (OII +3.4%) and Helix...

    Morgan Stanley upgrades FMC Technologies (FTI +1.5%), Oceaneering (OII +3.4%) and Helix Energy (HLX +1.7%) to Overweight from Equal Weight at Morgan Stanley (I, II, III), citing a pickup in the backlog for floating rigs, a leading indicator for subsea equipment demand which has risen to a record three years per rig, while at least 30% of the known floating fleet is contracted through 2020.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • SNTS

    Santarus (NASDAQ:SNTS) jumps 14.6% after the FDA approves the company's Uceris extended release...

    Santarus (NASDAQ:SNTS) jumps 14.6% after the FDA approves the company's Uceris extended release tablets for treating colitis. Santuras intends to launch the drug in March and now expects 2013 net profit of $50-54M and revenues of $320-325M. For 2012, Santarus believes it will have met or exceeded its guidance for profit of $12-14M and sales of $210M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • ARMH

    ARM (NASDAQ:ARMH) -5% thanks to a a downgrade to Equal-weight from Morgan Stanley. "It will be...

    ARM (NASDAQ:ARMH) -5% thanks to a a downgrade to Equal-weight from Morgan Stanley. "It will be difficult for news flow to improve from here, and ARM could still lose sockets here and there," the firm writes: it thinks expectations of mobile computing, micro-server, and telecom infrastructure share gains, and of higher royalty rates thanks to the adoption of its big.LITTLE architecture, are priced in. Piper downgraded ARM yesterday, but shares closed higher nonetheless.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • QLGC

    QLogic (NASDAQ:QLGC) +8.3% after stating it expects to report FQ3 (Dec. quarter) revenue of...

    QLogic (NASDAQ:QLGC) +8.3% after stating it expects to report FQ3 (Dec. quarter) revenue of ~$119M and EPS of $0.19-$0.20, above a consensus of $115.1M and $0.17. The company says it saw higher-than-expected revenue for Host products (storage adapter cards/controllers) and "particularly strong performance" for Network products (storage switches). Look for archrival Emulex (NYSE:ELX) to rise in sympathy. Both companies have had a rough time over the last 9 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures are lower while Europe turns almost uniformly red as the...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures are lower while Europe turns almost uniformly red as the German economy sliding into contraction and fears about the debt ceiling, and possibly a mixed U.S. data dump (I, II, III), keep markets down in the dumps. The S&P benchmark is -0.3%. Dell is +3.7% and adds to yesterday's sharp gains on speculation it's in talks to go private, while RBS slides 3.3% after a report it will have to pony up £500M over Libor. Later: Business Inventories, Fed speak
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • DELL-OLD

    Though many doubt (I, II) Dell's (DELL-OLD) reported LBO talks will pan out, shares are up 3.8%...

    Though many doubt (I, II) Dell's (DELL-OLD) reported LBO talks will pan out, shares are up 3.8% premarket to $12.76. For those keeping score, that gives Dell a market cap of $22.2B. This morning's move comes even though Monness Crespi is downgrading shares to Hold. P-E billionaire Wilbur Ross gives the deal a 50/50 chance of happening. "Remember [Dell] is a company whose earnings have been in a kind of free-fall."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • SEII

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT) +6.7% premarket after receiving $1.9M in follow-on purchase orders...

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT) +6.7% premarket after receiving $1.9M in follow-on purchase orders for its airflow-dyeing machines from its existing customer (earlier). CLNT will deliver a total of 21 airflow-dyeing machines using its patented production technique, for RMB11.8M (~ $1.9M).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • EXPR

    Premarket gainers: EXPR +14%. QLGC +8%. SNTS +8%. RSH +6%. Losers: COOL -32%. GIVN -14%....

    Premarket gainers: EXPR +14%. QLGC +8%. SNTS +8%. RSH +6%.
    Losers: COOL -32%. GIVN -14%. OTCQB:BODY -12%. LULU -6%. OTCQB:TELK -6%. SAP -5%. 
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • SBGL

    Stillwater Mining (SWC) +1.8% premarket after reporting its mined production of palladium and...

    Stillwater Mining (SWC) +1.8% premarket after reporting its mined production of palladium and platinum for Q4 was 132.5K oz. and for full-year 2012 totaled 513.7K oz., exceeding SWC's 2012 guidance of 500K oz. Total cash costs per mined oz. are expected at or slightly below 2012 guidance of $500; 2013 cash costs are seen averaging ~$560/oz.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
  • SAP

    SAP dives 5.2% in Frankfurt after announcing Q4 operating profit of €1.96B, short of...

    SAP dives 5.2% in Frankfurt after announcing Q4 operating profit of €1.96B, short of expectations for €2B. The move is dragging down the DAX, which is now off 1%. EWG -1.4% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM
  • PSTI

    Pluristem Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PSTI) climbs 6.5% after the developer of placenta-derived cell...

    Pluristem Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PSTI) climbs 6.5% after the developer of placenta-derived cell therapies receives German approval to start a Phase II study of its PLX-PAD cells in patients with Intermittent Claudication (IC), a subset of Peripheral Artery Disease that is characterized by muscle pain, numbness and fatigue, especially in the calf muscle. Around 14M people suffer from IC in the U.S.
